attributes.action: Create a cenotaph to honour all those who have given their lives serving the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
To respect and preserve the memories of those members of the NHS who have died while trying to ease the suffering of the sick.

This seems particularly apt during this time of the Coronavirus outbreak, when Doctors, Nurses and other NHS staff have lost their lives looking after others.

Such a memorial would be a fitting tribute to their memory and allow the public to show their thanks and respect.
attributes.background:
A cenotaph should be placed in a prominent location, to honour staff who have worked for the NHS and have given their lives doing so. 
Names should be added to this cenotaph annually along with a ceremony to honour them, akin to Remembrance Sunday.
